lexUnit.name: pleasant.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a person) friendly and considerate; likeable.

sentence.text: He could n't have been more chatty and pleasant .
The officer I have been escorting is a most pleasant chap , and I have really had a day 's holiday .
It was most interesting talking to him ; he really was a most pleasant man .
Jane Ashton was a slim girl , with short , soft hair curling around a face so pleasant that people automatically smiled when they met her .
He seemed a very pleasant person but he spoke no Bengali .
Comrade Wu our interpreter who will accompany us all the way is a very pleasant lady in her forties .
He seemed a really pleasant , friendly man , and I had admired his running before .
E. C. Llewellyn , the Professor , was a rich , pleasant man , interested in linguistics , who had assembled around him an excellent team .
I am sure the world is full of women who would appreciate a pleasant , hard-working man with regular habits , and would be happy to babysit Sophie and Ben .
The police driver asked for her documents but the woman explained , with a pleasant smile that they were at her home nearby .
It was Francis Clark who welcomed them into the building , a genial man with a pleasant smile on his face .
A nice firm handshake on introduction , pleasant , relaxed smile with no hint of hostility , just the expected male gleam of curiosity .
Her face was wrinkled with age but she looked friendly and her voice was pleasant when I heard her talk to the men .
He was pleasant about it , I 'll give him that .
If Gina was pleasant to him she could share ; if not , he would make them last for two meals .
So , be presentable , be articulate and be pleasant to everyone you meet .
For the remaining half-hour she would be pleasant to him , and then she would quietly and purposefully remind him of the time , and with gentle dignity insist that he take her home .
If she wanted this job , she would have to be reasonably pleasant to him , however much it stuck in her throat at times .
He was a polite man , invariably correct and pleasant with Mrs Collins , so this was done deliberately to elicit a response .
` But Jim is always pleasant with them .
The total work force equals 150 , it was noted that the workers all looked rather miserable and depressed and the working atmosphere was not at all pleasant .
A pleasant and sympathetic executive , she makes a good team player .
